Description: A deep cup of coarse red siltware pottery, the exterior covered by remains of a red slip. The base is flattened but remains convex. The vertical sides are slightly convex and there are three grooves around the vessel beneath the rim. The interior shows marks of rotary manufacture. All the upper part of one side is missing.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tell Dafana, Findspot 51, domestic buildings in the urban area to the east of the Saite enclosure (so-called "Camp").
Curator's comments: The Findspot number 51 has been scratched into the side.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 61 § 58, p. 64, 65, 66 § 61, pl. xxxv, 75)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.93, p.103, p.192, pl.34)
